pages.text: Amblysiphonella hails from the upper Carboniferous into the Permian, with fossils found right across the Northern Hemisphere. It is a branching demosponge, growing up to around 20 cm in size. Amblysiphonella is an incredibly common sponge, with records possibly going back into the Ordovician and Cambrian, and forward into the Triassic. Due to this, it is even used as an index fossil within a lot of upper Carboniferous formations.
